Package simulation.mmsolve

Class LUdcmp

java.lang.Object
simulation.mmsolve.LUdcmp
public class LUdcmp extends Object
Performs LU matrix decomposition and solved linear SOEs Used for Newton's method. Based on numerical recipes 3rd version and equations are references there

  • Constructor Details

    • LUdcmp

      public LUdcmp​(double[][] a) throws org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularMatrixException
      Constructs a LUdcmp object. Given a matrix a[0..n-1][0..n-1], this routine replaces it by the LU decomposition of a rowwise permutation of itself. On output, it is arranged as in equation (2.3.14); indx[0..n-1] is an output vector that records the row permutation effected by the partial pivoting; d is output as +/- 1 depending on whether the number of row interchanges was even or odd, respectively. This routine is used in combination with solve to solve linear equations or invert a matrix.
      Parameters:
      a - - the matrix A to decompose
      Throws:
      org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularMatrixException

  • Method Details

    • solve

      public void solve​(double[] b, double[] x) throws org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixDimensionMismatchException
      Solves the set of n linear equations A*x = b using the stored LU decomposition of A. b and x may reference the same vector, in which case the solution overwrites the input. This routine takes into account the possibility that b will begin with many zero elements, so it is efficient for use in matrix inversion.
      Parameters:
      b - - input as the right-hand side vector b[0..n-1]
      x - - returns the solution vector x
      Throws:
      org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixDimensionMismatchException

    • solve

      public void solve​(double[][] b, double[][] x) throws org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixDimensionMismatchException
      Solves m sets of n linear equations A*X = B using the stored LU decomposition of A. The matrix b[0..n-1][0..m-1] inputs the right-hand sides, while x[0..n-1][0..m-1] returns the solution A^{-1}*B. b and x may reference the same matrix, in which case the solution overwrites the input.
      Parameters:
      b - - the matrix b[0..n-1][0..m-1] that inputs the right-hand sides
      x - - the matrix x[0..n-1][0..m-1] that stores the solution A^{-1}*B
      Throws:
      org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixDimensionMismatchException

    • inverse

      public void inverse​(double[][] ainv) throws Exception
      Using the stored LU decomposition, return in ainv the matrix inverse A^{-1}
      Parameters:
      ainv - - stores (returns) the solution
      Throws:
      Exception

    • det

      public double det()
      Using the stored LU decomposition, calculates the determinant of the matrix A
      Returns:
      the determinant of the matrix A which was LU decomposed

    • mprove

      public void mprove​(double[] b, double[] x) throws Exception
      Improves a solution vector x[0..n-1] of the linear set of equations A*x = b. The vectors b[0..n-1] and x[0..n-1] are input. On output, x[0..n-1] is modified, to an improved set of values.
      Parameters:
      b - - the vector b[0..n-1] in the equation A*x = b
      x - - the vector x[0..n-1] in the equation A*x = b
      Throws:
      Exception
